conclusion: Objects A and B are initially above objects C, D, E, and F.
Objects C and D are placed on a black and white checkered fabric.
Objects E and F are placed on a brown and white checkered fabric.
Objects A and B move downward through the air due to gravity and come into contact with objects C, D, E, and F.
Upon contact, objects A and B exert force on the fabrics due to their weight.
The fabrics deform under the weight of objects A and B.
The deformation causes the fabrics to sag and potentially overlap slightly at the point of contact.
Both the black and white checkered fabric and the brown and white checkered fabric will be visibly deformed.
Objects A and B will rest on top of objects C, D, E, and F, pressing them into the fabrics.
The final state will be that both fabrics are deformed, and objects A and B rest on top of the respective objects below them, pressing them down into the fabrics.
